result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ellis McArthur Mitchell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ellis McArthur Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Ellis McArthur Mitchell.  Attorney Michael Jerome Lonski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Projected Guilty Plea this date.  Parties do not have a resolution.  State requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 27, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ellis McArthur Mitchell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Ellis McArthur Mitchell in custody.  Michael Schindhelm for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Projected Guilty Plea this date.  Defense requests adjournment as he needs an offer from the State.  Court grants request.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ellis McArthur Mitchell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Ellis McArthur Mitchell in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense requested a Plea Hearing date.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ellis McArthur Mitchell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Ellis McArthur Mitchell in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense received Discovery and requested time for review.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ellis McArthur Mitchell in court, in custody with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  BOTH BY VIDEO.  Paul Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense moves to dismiss the complaint. Motion is denied. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ellis McArthur Mitchell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Ellis McArthur Mitchell in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ellis McArthur Mitchell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
